summary: In this context, 2-methoxy-2-methylpropane and 4-xylene are both mentioned as organic contaminants of concern in groundwater systems, particularly in relation to their biodegradation and removal mechanisms. However, there is no direct discussion of their specific interactions or relationships, as the focus is primarily on the broader category of BTEX compounds and their environmental impact. Thus, while they are both relevant to the topic of groundwater contamination, their connection is not explicitly detailed.
